column3: "Alt-architecture" promotes an approach to art projects that question the practices and objects of hegemonic architecture, either through criticism and reflection or generating new alternatives and perspectives, often related to collaborative practices and policies resistance. The exhibition is presented as a portfolio of proposals for the common pursuit of constructive ideas proposing a dialogue between two singular artistic behaviors: Rethinking architecture from its representation (the model, scale reproduction or abstraction of their minimum elements) and from the direct action on the built reality. In this duality it activates both the metaphorical and emotional as the social and the political. Lara works Almarcegui, Fernanda Fragateiro, Gordon Matta-Clark, Jordi Colomer or Daniel Buren, among others, allow the viewer to question the architectural reality: from the symbolic construction to everyday reality. + Info

China dominated the Ming Dynasty for 276 years. Between 1368 and 1644, sixteen emperors of the Zhu family ruled a population that increased to about 175 million. During the dynastic period, China achieved great prosperity and became famous in Europe as a supplier of luxury items and as a place full of mystery. The combination of wealth and external influences generated within society Ming China tensions that transformed forever. In Chinese, Da Ming means 'great light'. In addition, the reign of each of the emperors was known by a special name chosen to describe its particular character. Thus, the time of the first emperor Zhu Yuanzhang, from 1368 to 1398, was known as the Hongwu period, which means "extraordinary martial ', a name that reveals the military origins of the Ming, who overthrew the Yuan Dynasty, established by the Mongols in the year 1271. the other possible defense against foreign domination, especially from the north, marked the mood of the Ming dynasty. To avoid a strong central power, efficient and great armies were considered essential communications. A return to traditional Chinese family values, education, culture, hierarchy and social stability is also required. However, other forces came into play: on the one hand, increased trade, helped by the arrival of foreign silver from Japan and South America, questioned the established order; on the other, the population grew, cities grew and grew a new "consumer culture" among the emerging merchant class. The certainties of the past began to unravel. With "Ming. The golden rule" the Spanish public will have the opportunity to learn the art and culture of this dynasty beyond the iconic white and blue porcelain. Visitors will discover the great artistic, social and economic advances that allow you to define the period of government of the Ming dynasty as the golden rule of Chinese history. For nearly three centuries, sixteen Ming emperors ruled over a population that went from 65 to nearly 175 million who lived the development of a complex imperial system, expanding social structures and the momentum of the economy and consumer culture. It prolonged and stable mandate provided a solid basis for creativity and social progress, which led to the exceptional artistic, social and economic transformations that are discussed in this major exhibition. The exhibition will include over a hundred objects from the impressive collections of the Museum of Nanjing, as singular Ming ceramics, paintings by some of the most prestigious artists of the time, exquisite jewelry, textiles and works of enamel, gilding and porcelain that never before have seen in Spain. As says the deputy director of Nanjing Museum, Lumin Huang, "are really exceptional national treasures and many of them had not left China before this exhibition". + Info

A work of Clarence Barlow for electronic video and six channels. When you requested by my art collector friend Los Angeles, Raj Dhawan to write music for an exhibition of his collection of Alphonse Mucha (1860-1939) paintings, which in turn thought to base the music on a lot of compatriot and contemporary. My choice fell on the composer Leos Janacek (1854-1928), born, like Mucha, in Moravia (then in the Austrian Empire, now in the Czech Republic). Thirty-seven paintings selected Mucha correspond to the same number of pieces Janácek, many movements of the greatest works. The larger painting, longer will be the music selections are. At first, the music is limited to the range of minor seventh, all notes outside this range are discarded. The notes also are redistributed among the five instruments - flute, clarinet, violin, cello and piano - and the range gradually increases to just over four octaves, each instrument is assigned exactly ten notes then. Analogue to this, each painting Mucha shown for the first time only with its most common color, and the rest is colored in gray. During the execution of each Janáček music, colors Mucha works expand on the range, starting at the center of the image, to finally include all original colors. This audiovisual composition bears) Ertur title (which - due to the worsening ranges pitch, area and color - could be expanded to include words like opening (English, French), Opening (Czech, Italian, Polish), copertura (Italian ), opening / Coverage (Spanish, Portuguese) or overture (Spanish), everything that involves opening or cover. "Ertur" comes to mean "peas" in Icelandic. the photo shows the beginning an aerial view of St. Thomas 'Abbey, Brno. According to authoritative sources, Mucha sang here as a child in a choir run by the young Janáček. the music is entirely Janácek, gradually expanding the range of a minor 7 (C4-Bb4) to approximately four octaves (C3-Qb7) at the end. 37 pieces / Janáček movements are matched with 37 paintings Mucha. the square root of the areas in inches ( ") of running the lot is equal to the corresponding durations selection Janáček in question seconds ( "). a thud that precedes each section is derived from a count that is used in the recordings of the film. Selection of over 300 photographs of Philippe Halsman, considered one of the most important photographers of the twentieth century, renowned for its 101 LIFE magazine covers, as well as its extensive collaboration with Salvador Dali. The exhibition draws on the most valued pieces of familiar artistic background and presents a complete retrospective of his work that includes for the first time its initial stage in Paris. The exhibition is divided into four sections, where a wide variety of subjects such as portraits, fashion, performances and publications, which especially highlights the photographic performance called jumpology, which consists of photographing famous people jumping is presented. + Info

Opening on Thursday May 19. Exhibition May 20 to July 1, 2016. The Mexican artist Paola Dolphin (Mexico City, 1989) presents his first exhibition in Barcelona under the title "Roots", a march back to the origin of life, as a natural miracle which is connected to the earth. "there are tap roots that travel through lakes, valleys, meadows, mountains, forests, clouds and tides, as well as other branched and tuberous, rather accumulate reserve substances, regardless of type or size . All of them always go beyond the confines of freedom and adhere to the depths of his spirit. "The work of Paola part illustration and mixing organic forms and breathes femininity, through characters who invade walls, paper, fabric and unusual materials. the exhibition, like each of the works that comprise it , it is a story with multiple paths, various trunks that give support to branches and leaves that stain the past, present and those memories that become the unique foundation to claw to keep the stump. "Roots" invites you to take up this, where more thick the main branch, and more complex and abstract lost language that sounds, it is the drive where the elements of life find their livelihood. and this is where celebrate their evolution and allow us to grow in an unpredictable, chaotic and wild way, with enough strength and depth to teach us to carve our own existence. + info

Opening June 16, 19h the new series of paintings of the young Barcelona artist Sandra de la Cruz is presented at last. This collection refers to magic as that point where it is not possible to distinguish reality from imagination, that moment can change our lives and that we are not able to explain because it is beyond reason and understanding, images where we find feelings of desire, eroticism and sensuality with restraint and very subtle. The series comes from wanting to express these feelings and emotions that make us human, we return to the origin of a relaxed, carefree manner, making it almost a game. But also with traps, hazards; the forbidden inspiring, evoking all that makes us mistake and learn from life, our bodies and ourselves. Recurring items are repeated in the form of obsession, it entered a dark world but beauty and sensuality. These paintings are based on photographs taken in intimate moment with mixed feelings at different times and people who, by chance (or magic), together in one time and place. Sometimes the eroticism that may suggest the image hides a whisper that mixes confusion, love and stark reality, like a frozen instant in the life of anyone who can change forever. Sponsor Moritz Vitacoco // 100% Naturelle + info

column2: The pesanervios - Workshop performance by Joan Morey
column3: What is a performance? How to prepare an art project in this format? What to consider before making a performance? Does the performance as any work of art? What are the documents, publications or traces from a performative work? Is there to be a performer for a performance? This workshop aims to answer these and other questions regarding public of the performace, financing, the space of representation, the figure of the performer, duration, serialization, image rights, the strategic plan and multiple practical aspects use performance as a means of artistic expression effectively. Besides being an artistic discipline the use, performance works often as an escape route for artistic practice in times of crisis. And we do not mean only the economic crisis but also the crisis of the artist in front of the art system, the crisis before the creation of objects and even the crisis of meaning production. The use of performance can be intercalated here as motor, language or field tests, and those who use it will have to adapt to your needs, overcome idioms that surround it and know if it is or not the appropriate means of artistic expression to carry out his creative work. + info

Abandoned by the moral and inspired by temporary altered states, the duo of artists not hide being attracted to electronics, pleasure, drugs, loops and disinhibition, leaving evident in this politically incorrect work, laden with sarcasm, playfulness and a single clear objective experimentation. For the opening of ROTTEN HEDONISM and opening the special program on the occasion of the expo, will have the performance of the DJ and producer Hyperaktivist, resident in Berlin, we will accompany the artists responsible for all Michele Guidarini + Cane and as has become a classic, gifts for everyone! * Heat hell quelled thanks to Moritz and Jägermeister. INAUGURATION: Wednesday 1 to 20: 00h.
"Alba" is an ethereal look of the space we inhabit. A journey through the memories of an abandoned world. Synthesizing subconscious of a dream landscape. A romantic pursuit of the sublime, unattainable.
abstract forms that when combined produce feelings of calm, nostalgia, mystery and remoteness. Sometimes it used nature as a source of inspiration, other urban boundary. In any case, open spaces that evoke moods by using the basic elements of the composition.
Emotional ambiguity thrives on the atmosphere in each work. There are influences of impressionism and Japanese prints and minimalist vision. But also about sound landscape as Tim Hecker or William Basinski.
It occurs in nature wild and abysmally, huge tracts do not necessarily represent real places. Landscapes in which the human soul can identify and understand emotions unable to be described in words.
As for the used technique referred to several concepts. First signs of the local businesses of the first stage of the post-Franco Spain. a duality between the original and the manufactured or produced in series, referring to the post-industrial society and its relationship with the individual is also established. Finally, a dialogue process between analog and digital creation, so present in our day, as it transfers the songwriting not definitive of the actual graphics software and volume.
+ info
